info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 02 at 6:49PM EDT until July 02 at 7:15PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern Caldwell County in western North Carolina... Central Avery County in western North Carolina... * Until 715 PM EDT. * At 648 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 5 miles southwest of Foscoe, or near Grandfather Mountain State Park, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Newland, Blowing Rock In Caldwell County, Banner Elk, Beech Mountain In Avery County, Sugar Mountain, Seven Devils, Grandfather Mountain State Park, Linville, Upton and B.R. Parkway-Linville Falls To Grandfather. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
